title: [Large-scale] Simulation Learning to Overcome Social Bias in Clinical Decision-making

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge, general understanding of pedagogy, and foundational awareness of decision-making processes in social relationships
context.additional_context: A meta-learning course for pre-service and in-service teachers, integrating clinical case analysis with educational scenarios. It focuses on examining the impact of societal biases in educational settings and fostering civic responsibility.

learning_goals: In a simulated environment, learners identify and explain four major cognitive biases (momentum, confirmation, probability calculation, sequence effects) within social relational contexts.
When biases occur, learners implement recovery strategies that integrate critical thinking and civic awareness to correct decision-making errors by at least 70%.
During debriefing, learners engage at least 80% in peer feedback and self-reflection using bias-resistant frameworks, exploring ways to promote civic rights in educational settings.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
